title: 5 drug suspects shot dead
text:
5 drug suspects shot dead (The Philippine Star) | Updated March 9, 2017 - 12:00am Rion Jasshra Boncalan, a resident of Barangay Saog in Marilao town, was walking along MacArthur highway when he was shot. The gunmen left a piece of paper identifying the fatality as a drug pusher and robber. AP Photo/Aaron Favila 
MANILA, Philippines - Unidentified motorcycle-riding men killed three more drug suspects in Bulacan while two were slain in a raid in Marawi City on Tuesday. 
Rion Jasshra Boncalan, a resident of Barangay Saog in Marilao town, was walking along MacArthur highway when he was shot. The gunmen left a piece of paper identifying the fatality as a drug pusher and robber. 
Joselito Catiis, 52, of Poblacion, Sta. Maria was fired at along the road in Barangay Poblacion in Sta. Maria. 
Danilo Francisco was playing basketball in Barangay Catanghalan in Obando when he was shot several times. He was declared dead on arrival at the Makatao Women’s Hospital in Malabon City. A piece of cardboard that read, tulak/adik, wag tularan (drug pusher/addict, don’t emulate)” was recovered near his body. 
Cairodin Anto and Pango Anto reportedly shot it out with police operatives serving search warrants for illegal drugs in Barangays Basak Malutlut and Raya Sanduc, respectively. 
Chief Superintendent Theodore Sindac, Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao police director, said the fatalities were ”high-value” drug targets and provided financial support to the Maute group.   13 nabbed, P.5 M shabu seized 
Meanwhile, 13 suspected drug personalities were arrested under the Oplan Double Barrel Reloaded on Tuesday. 
Cherry Ann Corpuz, Christopher Galsim, Rommel Reyes, Mark Arzil, Mary Ann Laungayan and Angelito Vicente were collared after a raid on a suspected drug den in Barangay Minien West in Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan yielded sachets of shabu with an estimated street value of P500,000. 
Six others, including a woman, who was sniffing shabu, were arrested in raids in Santiago City, Isabela; Gattaran, Cagayan and Baguio City also yesterday as well as in Daet and Basud towns in Camarines Norte and Legazpi City, Albay on Tuesday. 
Police said the suspects are on the drug watchlists in their respective barangays. – Ric Sapnu, Eva Visperas, Raymund Catindig, Artemio Dumlao, Francis Elevado, Cecille Suerte Felipe
